t: Jeremiah 10
Idols and the True God
Hear*p the word which the Lord*s speaks to you, O house of Israel.
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Do*pn not learn the way of the Gentiles; Do*ld not be dismayed at the signs of heaven, For*ld the Gentiles are dismayed at them.
For*ld the customs of the peoples are*i futile; For*ld one*i cuts a tree from the forest, The*ld work of the hands of the workman, with the ax.
They*ld decorate it with silver and gold; They*ld fasten it with nails and hammers So*ld that it will not topple.

They*ld are*i upright, like a palm tree, And*ld they cannot speak; They*ld must be carried, Because*ld they cannot go by*i themselves.*i Do*ld not be afraid of them, For*ld they cannot do evil, Nor*ld can they do any good.”
Inasmuch*ln as there*i is*i none like You, O Lord*s (You*ld are*i great, and Your name is*i great in might),
Who*ld would not fear You, O King of the nations? For*ld this is Your rightful due. For*ld among all the wise men*i of the nations, And*ld in all their kingdoms, There*ild is*i none like You.
But*ld they are altogether dull-hearted and foolish; A*ld wooden idol is*i a worthless doctrine.

Silver*ld is beaten into plates; It*ld is brought from Tarshish, And*ld gold from Uphaz, The*ld work of the craftsman And*ld of the hands of the metalsmith; Blue*ld and purple are*i their clothing; They*ld are*i all the work of skillful men.*i
But*ld the Lord*s is*i the true God; He*ld is*i the living God and the everlasting King. At*ld His wrath the earth will tremble, And*ld the nations will not be able to endure His indignation.
Thus*p you shall say to them: “The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth shall perish from the earth and from under these heavens.”
He*pn has made the earth by His power, He*ld has established the world by His wisdom, And*ld has stretched out the heavens at His discretion.

When*ld He utters His voice, There*ild is*i a multitude of waters in the heavens: “And*ld He causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth. He*ld makes lightning for the rain, He*ld brings the wind out of His treasuries.”
Everyone*ln is dull-hearted, without knowledge; Every*ld metalsmith is put to shame by an image; For*ld his molded image is*i falsehood, And*ld there*i is*i no breath in them.
They*ld are*i futile, a work of errors; In*ld the time of their punishment they shall perish.
The*ld Portion of Jacob is*i not like them, For*ld He is*i the Maker of all things,*i And*ld Israel is*i the tribe of His inheritance; The*ld Lord*s of hosts is*i His name.
The Coming Captivity of Judah
Gather*pn up your wares from the land, O*ld inhabitant of the fortress!
For*p thus says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn I will throw out at this time The*ld inhabitants of the land, And*ld will distress them, That*ld they may find it*i so.”*i
Woe*ln is me for my hurt! My*ld wound is severe. But*ld I say, “Truly this is*i an infirmity, And*ld I must bear it.”
My*ld tent is plundered, And*ld all my cords are broken; My*ld children have gone from me, And*ld they are*i no more. There*ild is*i no one to pitch my tent anymore, Or*ld set up my curtains.
For*ln the shepherds have become dull-hearted, And*ld have not sought the Lord;*s Therefore*ld they shall not prosper, And*ld all their flocks shall be scattered.
Behold,*ld the noise of the report has come, And*ld a great commotion out of the north country, To*ld make the cities of Judah desolate, a den of jackals.
O*ln Lord,*s I know the way of man is*i not in himself; It*ild is*i not in man who walks to direct his own steps.
O*ld Lord,*s correct me, but with justice; Not*ld in Your anger, lest You bring me to nothing.

Pour*ld out Your fury on the Gentiles, who do not know You, And*ld on the families who do not call on Your name; For*ld they have eaten up Jacob, Devoured*ld him and consumed him, And*ld made his dwelling place desolate.
